column4: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xfree86 seems to have no effect
oh, it works if I run it in a terminal.
did you hand-edit?
it you hand-edited it, you'll have to re-set the md5sum
does the md5sum of your file match that listed in /var/lib/xfree86/ ?
can you ls /var/lib/xfree86 ?
the XF86Config-4.md5sum has to match the md5sum of your /etc/X11/XF86Config-4, or dpkg-reconfigure won't work
It matches.
good deal
what does "sudo ddcprobe" return?
Whole bunch of modes.
what about rates?
did you check /var/log/XFree86.0.log for errors?
it may be that you need to manaully specify HorizSync and VertRefresh for your monitor.
do those match your monitor specs?
what is your monitor capable of?
I mean the rates
i.e., are those rates you pasted above right?
you should find out the specs of your monitor.
that's not advisable
